pageContext.claim: “Even the media said the crowd was massive … that was all the way back down to the Washington Monument.”
pageContext.analysis: Speaking at the Armed Services Post-Inauguration ball, Trump exaggerated the size of the crowd. It did not go all the way to the Washington Monument. No matter how you calculate it, Trump’s crowd was significantly smaller than Obama’s crowd — and the Women’s March on Washington the next day. Trump was so upset when his crowd comments were challenged that he ordered White House press secretary Sean Spicer to give the White House press corps a tongue lashing in a briefing riddled with false claims. "This is an appalling performance by the new press secretary. He managed to make a series of false and misleading claims in service of a relatively minor issue. Presumably he was ordered to do this by Trump, who conjured up fantastic numbers in his own mind, but part of a flack’s job is to tell the boss when lies are necessary — and when they are not," we wrote. "Spicer earns Four Pinocchios, but seriously, we wish we could give five."
